title: Virtual Learning Language-Integrated Instructional Design Strategies for [Massive] Online Nursing Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational nursing theory, educational experience, and comprehension of medical terminology (symptoms, diagnostics, treatment-related vocabulary)
context.additional_context: Online curriculum design integrating medical terminology (patient explanation, medical record documentation) and pedagogical methods for pre-service nurse educators.

learning_goals: Learners can apply three or more learner-content interaction strategies (e.g., terminology-based simulations) for acquiring medical terminology in online environments

Learners design two types of language-centered activities (e.g., symptom-description role-play, diagnostic report feedback) for learner-instructor and learner-learner collaboration in a virtual learning platform.
Learners develop one formative assessment tool (including medical terminology accuracy and communication skills evaluation) to assess the effectiveness of nursing education in a blended environment.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
